title: Two Swords
transcript:
JAIME LANNISTER: Magnificent.
TYWIN LANNISTER: Mm-hmm.
JAIME LANNISTER: Looks fresh-forged.
TYWIN LANNISTER: It is.
JAIME LANNISTER: No one's made a Valyrian steel sword since the Doom of Valyria.
TYWIN LANNISTER: There are three living smiths who know how to rework Valyrian steel. The finest of them was in Volantis. Came here to King's Landing at my invitation.
JAIME LANNISTER: Where did you get this much Valyrian steel?
TYWIN LANNISTER: From someone who no longer had need of it.
JAIME LANNISTER: You've wanted one of these in the family for a long time.
TYWIN LANNISTER: And now we have two.
JAIME LANNISTER: Two?
TYWIN LANNISTER: The original weapon was absurdly large. Plenty of steel for two swords.
JAIME LANNISTER: Well, thank you. It's glorious."
TYWIN LANNISTER: You'll have to train your left hand.
JAIME LANNISTER: Any decent swordsman knows how to use both hands.
TYWIN LANNISTER: You'll never be as good.
JAIME LANNISTER: No. But as long as I'm better than everyone else, I suppose it doesn't matter."
TYWIN LANNISTER: You can't serve in the Kingsguard with one hand.
JAIME LANNISTER: Where's that written? I can and I will. The Kingsguard oath is for life.
TYWIN LANNISTER: The war is over. The king is safe. The king is never safe.
JAIME LANNISTER: How many people in this city alone would love to see his head on a pike?
TYWIN LANNISTER: Other knights protected the king while you were a prisoner. They will continue to do so when you go home.
JAIME LANNISTER: Home?
TYWIN LANNISTER: You'll return to Casterly Rock and rule in my stead.
JAIME LANNISTER: You are the Lord of Casterly Rock.
TYWIN LANNISTER: I am the King's Hand. My place is here. I don't expect to see the Rock again before I die.
JAIME LANNISTER: You know what they call me? Kingslayer. Oathbreaker. Man without honor. Now you want me to break another sacred vow.
TYWIN LANNISTER: You won't be breaking anything. There is a precedent to relieve a Kingsguard of his duties. The king will exercise that prerogative.
JAIME LANNISTER: No.
TYWIN LANNISTER: No?
TYWIN LANNISTER: I don't believe I asked you a question.
JAIME LANNISTER: There's my answer.
TYWIN LANNISTER: If you think your bloody honor comes before...
JAIME LANNISTER: My bloody honor is beyond repair, but my answer is still no. I don't want Casterly Rock. I don't want a wife. I don't want children."
TYWIN LANNISTER: What do you want?
JAIME LANNISTER: Supper would be nice.
TYWIN LANNISTER: For 40 years I've tried to teach you. If you haven't learned by now, you never will. Go. If serving as a glorified bodyguard is the sum of your ambition, go serve."
JAIME LANNISTER: I suppose you want the sword back.
TYWIN LANNISTER: Keep it.
TYWIN LANNISTER: A one-handed man with no family needs all the help he can get.
BRONN: How many Dornishmen does it take to fuck a goat?
TYRION LANNISTER: Please don't.
BRONN: Seems to me the smart place to meet travelers is in a tavern. That way, one party is late, the other party can drink some ale inside."
TYRION LANNISTER: This is the Prince of Dorne we're waiting for, not one of your sellsword friends."
BRONN: If he's so damned important, how come they sent you to meet him?"
TYRION LANNISTER: There's bad blood between the Martells of Dorne and the Lannisters of Casterly Rock. Has been for years.
BRONN: And just in case the Martells of Dorne are looking to spill some Lannister blood, it may as well be yours, eh?"
TYRION LANNISTER: No need for cynicism. I happen to be an accomplished diplomat.
BRONN: Oh.
TYRION LANNISTER: Ah, here we are."
TYRION LANNISTER: Can you read the sigils?
BRONN: Yellow balls?
PODRICK: Wild lemons on a purple field, House Dalt of Lemonwood. A vulture grasping a baby in it's talons, House Blackmont. A crowned skull, the Manwoodys of Kingsgrave."
TYRION LANNISTER: Boy knows his Dornish Houses.
BRONN: I need a sigil.
TYRION LANNISTER: And House Martell, a red sun pierced by a spear?"
PODRICK: I don't see it, my lord."
TYRION LANNISTER: Well met, my lords. His Grace King Joffrey welcomes you in his name. My lord father, the King's Hand, sends his greetings as well. I am Tyrion Lannister of Casterly Rock, Master of Coin. Forgive me. I don't see Prince Doran in your company."
DORNISH LORD: The prince's health forces him to remain at Sunspear. He sends his brother Prince Oberyn to attend the royal wedding in his stead.
TYRION LANNISTER: Yes, the king will be delighted to enjoy the company of a warrior as renowned as Prince Oberyn at his wedding feast."
DORNISH LORD: Will he?
TYRION LANNISTER: And where is Prince Oberyn?
DORNISH LORD: Arrived before dawn. Not a man for welcome parties, our prince."
TYRION LANNISTER: Very well. My lords, these fine men from the City Watch will escort you to your quarters in the Red Keep."
TYRION LANNISTER: You must be weary after such a long journey.
BRONN: Some accomplished diplomacy that was. Now where?
TYRION LANNISTER: We must find Prince Oberyn before he kills somebody or several somebodies.
BRONN: How do you plan on finding a single Dornishman in a city this big?
TYRION LANNISTER: You're famous for fucking half of Westeros. You just arrived at the capital after two weeks of bad roads, where would you go?"
BRONN: I'd probably go to sleep, but I'm getting old."
OBERYN MARTELL: Look at this one. How lovely is she?
ELLARIA: Beautiful. But pale.
OBERYN MARTELL: They like them pale in the capital. Shows they don't work the fields.
OBERYN MARTELL: You like?
ELLARIA: Timid. Timid bores me.
OBERYN MARTELL: You're a bit of mischief, aren't you?"
OBERYN MARTELL: I think she likes you. ELLARIA"" She has good taste."
OBERYN MARTELL: You're not timid, are you?"
ELLARIA: Not timid.
OBERYN MARTELL: Do you like women?
WHORE: When they look like her, my lord."
ELLARIA: This one will do nicely.
OLYVAR: Very good, my lady."
ELLARIA: Oh, I'm not a lady."
OLYVAR: A term of courtesy in this establishment.
ELLARIA: A lie anywhere. Why not use the right words? I'm a bastard. She is a whore. And you're what? A procurer.
OLYVAR: Any of the others?
OBERYN MARTELL: The two girls can leave.
OBERYN MARTELL: You stay.
OLYVAR: I'm afraid I'm not an offer, my lord."
OBERYN MARTELL: Everyone who works for Littlefinger is an offer. Take off your clothes. We'll be here a while.
OLYVAR: My lord.
OBERYN MARTELL: I am a prince, boy. Have you ever been with a prince?"
OLYVAR: Can't say I have. I'm wildly expensive.
OBERYN MARTELL: Take off your clothes.
OLYVAR: Which way do you like it?
OBERYN MARTELL: My way .
MORGAN: And so he spoke and so he spoke That Lord of Castamere. And now the rains
ELLARIA: Oberyn.
MORGAN: Weep o'er his hall...
ELLARIA: Oberyn, don't."
MORGAN: With no one there to hear Yes, not the rains weep o'er his hall And not a soul to hear."
MORGANS FRIEND: You lost, friend?"
OBERYN MARTELL: Forgive me for staring. I don't see many Lannisters where I'm from.
MORGANS FRIEND: I don't see many Dornishmen in the capital.
OBERYN MARTELL: We don't like the smell.
ELLARIA: Come with me, lover."
MORGAN: Gods, look at this one."
OLYVAR: Sirs, if you follow me, I'll arrange for a private room."
MORGAN: Why are you wasting a woman like this on a Dornishman? Bring him a shaved goat and a bottle of olive oil.
OBERYN MARTELL: Do you know why all the world hates a Lannister?
OBERYN MARTELL: You think your gold and your lions and your gold lions make you better than everyone. May I tell you a secret? You're not a golden lion. You're just a pink little man who is far too slow on the draw.
OBERYN MARTELL: Longsword is a bad option in close quarters. When I pull my blade, your friend starts bleeding. Quite a lot, I'm afraid. So many veins in the wrist."
OBERYN MARTELL: He'll live if you get him help straightaway. So, decisions."
TYRION LANNISTER: Prince Oberyn, forgive the intrusion. We heard there might be..."
TYRION LANNISTER: trouble.
OBERYN MARTELL: Apologies, my love."
TYRION LANNISTER: I'm here to welcome you to the capital.
OBERYN MARTELL: Ellaria Sand, my paramour. The king's own Uncle Imp. Tyrion, son of Tywin Lannister."
TYRION LANNISTER: If there's anything I can do to make your stay...
OBERYN MARTELL: What are you? His hired killer?
BRONN: It started that way, aye. Now I'm a knight."
OBERYN MARTELL: How did that come to pass?
BRONN: Killed the right people, I suppose."
OBERYN MARTELL: We'll need a few more girls. Girls, yes?"
TYRION LANNISTER: Oh, I partook. Now I'm married."
TYRION LANNISTER: Prince Oberyn, if I may, a word in private?"
OBERYN MARTELL: Seems I visited the Lannister brothel by mistake.
TYRION LANNISTER: Oh, they take all kinds."
OBERYN MARTELL: Even Dornishmen.
TYRION LANNISTER: The king is very grateful that you traveled all this way for his wedding.
OBERYN MARTELL: Let us speak truth here. Joffrey is insulted. I am only the second son after all.
TYRION LANNISTER: Well, speaking as a fellow second son, I have grown rather used to being the family insult."
TYRION LANNISTER: Why did you come to King's Landing, Prince Oberyn?"
OBERYN MARTELL: I was invited to the royal wedding.
TYRION LANNISTER: I thought we were speaking truth.
OBERYN MARTELL: The last time I was in the capital was many years ago. Another wedding. My sister Elia and Rhaegar Targaryen, the Last Dragon. My sister loved him. She bore his children. Swaddled them, rocked them, fed them at her own breast. Elia wouldn't let the wet nurse touch them. And beautiful, noble Rhaegar Targaryen left her for another woman. That started a war and the war ended right here when your father's army took the city..."
TYRION LANNISTER: I wasn't actually present.
OBERYN MARTELL: And butchered those children. My nephew and niece. Carved them up and wrapped them in Lannister cloaks. And my sister, you know what they did to her?"
OBERYN MARTELL: I'm asking you a question.
TYRION LANNISTER: I've heard rumors.
OBERYN MARTELL: So have I. The one I keep hearing is that Gregor Clegane the Mountain raped Elia and split her in half with his great sword.
TYRION LANNISTER: I wasn't there. I don't know what happened.
OBERYN MARTELL: If the Mountain killed my sister, your father gave the order. Tell your father I'm here. And tell him the Lannisters aren't the only ones who pay their debts."
JORAH MORMONT: They're dragons, Khaleesi. They can never be tamed. Not even by their mother."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Ser Barristan.
BARRISTAN: Your Grace.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Where's Daario Naharis? Where's Grey Worm?
BARRISTAN: Gambling, Your Grace."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Gambling?
CROWD: Mhysa. Mhysa. Mhysa...
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: How long have they been at it?
MISSANDEI: Since midnight, Your Grace."
DAARIO: Ser Worm is stronger than he looks. But I can see his arms beginning to shake.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: What's the prize to winning this stupid contest?
DAARIO: The honor of riding by your side on the road to Meereen.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: That honor goes to Ser Jorah and Ser Barristan as neither of them kept me waiting this morning. You two will ride in the rear guard and protect the livestock.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: The last man holding his sword can find a new queen to fight for.
DAARIO: You like this girl? Must be frustrating.
GREY WORM: You are not a smart man, Daario Naharis."
DAARIO: I'd rather have no brains and two balls.
SHAE: You need to eat something.
SHAE: Pigeon pie.
SANSA STARK: No, thank you."
SHAE: Lemon cakes?
SHAE: You love lemon cakes.
SHAE: Tell her she needs to eat.
TYRION LANNISTER: My lady, you do need to eat."
SANSA STARK: I don't need to eat.
TYRION LANNISTER: If I could have a moment alone with my wife.
SHAE: She needs to eat.
TYRION LANNISTER: I can't let you starve.
TYRION LANNISTER: I swore to protect you.
TYRION LANNISTER: My lady, I am your husband. Let me help you."
SANSA STARK: How can you help me?
TYRION LANNISTER: I don't know, but I can try."
SANSA STARK: I lie awake all night staring at the canopy thinking about how they died.
TYRION LANNISTER: I could get you essence of nightshade to help you sleep.
SANSA STARK: Do you know what they did to my brother? How they sewed his direwolf's head onto his body? And my mother. They say they cut her throat to the bone and threw her body in the river.
TYRION LANNISTER: What happened to your family was a terrible crime. I didn't know your brother. He seemed like a good man, but I didn't know him. Your mother, on the other hand, I admired her. She wanted to have me executed, but I admired her. She was a strong woman. And she was fierce when it came to protecting her children. Sansa. Your mother would want you to carry on. You know it's true."
SANSA STARK: Will you pardon me, my lord? I'd like to visit the godswood."
TYRION LANNISTER: Of course. Of course. Prayer can be helpful, I hear."
SANSA STARK: I don't pray anymore. It's the only place I can go where people don't talk to me.
SHAE: My lion.
TYRION LANNISTER: What are you doing?
SHAE: What does it look like I'm doing? Come here.
TYRION LANNISTER: How many times have I told you? You can't visit me here.
SHAE: I know. I know. We have come to a dangerous place. Have you forgotten me? Do you know how long it's been?
TYRION LANNISTER: Of course I haven't forgotten.
SHAE: I want you. Don't you want me?
TYRION LANNISTER: Things are a bit tense right now.
SHAE: What things?
TYRION LANNISTER: My nephew the king wants to murder me. My wife hates me because my father murdered her family. Oberyn Martell wants to murder everyone whose last name is Lannister.
SHAE: You need to relax.
SHAE: Don't you want to relax?
SHAE: What's wrong?
TYRION LANNISTER: I told you. It's not a good time.
SHAE: It's never a good time. You have your child bride now.
TYRION LANNISTER: Shae.
SHAE: Do you love her?
TYRION LANNISTER: Love her? I barely know her. She's a child. She despises me.
SHAE: That's not an answer.
TYRION LANNISTER: Of course I don't love her.
SHAE: You tried to ship me away.
TYRION LANNISTER: Ship you away?
SHAE: Give me diamonds and make me disappear.
TYRION LANNISTER: What in the world are you talking about?
SHAE: If you want me to leave, just say it. Say it!"
TYRION LANNISTER: Shh. I don't know what you're talking about.
SHAE: You want me to stay?
QYBURN: A work of art, really. The craftsmanship is excellent."
JAIME LANNISTER: You like it so much, you're welcome to chop off your own hand and take it."
CERSEI LANNISTER: Such an ingrate. I spent days with the goldsmith - getting the details just right.
JAIME LANNISTER: Days?
CERSEI LANNISTER: Better part of an afternoon. There, how does that feel?"
JAIME LANNISTER: Uh... a hook would be more practical.
CERSEI LANNISTER: Elegant, I think."
CERSEI LANNISTER: Thank you for your help with the other matter.
QYBURN: The symptoms have abated?
CERSEI LANNISTER: Gone completely. I am in your debt, Maester Qyburn."
QYBURN: Not a maester, Your Grace, but happy to help whenever I can."
JAIME LANNISTER: Odd little man.
CERSEI LANNISTER: I've grown rather fond of him. He's quite talented, you know?"
JAIME LANNISTER: What symptoms?
CERSEI LANNISTER: Symptoms that are not your concern.
JAIME LANNISTER: You let him touch you?
CERSEI LANNISTER: You jealous?
JAIME LANNISTER: I'm surprised. You never let Pycelle near you.
CERSEI LANNISTER: You think I'd let that old lecher put his hands on me? He smells like a dead cat.
JAIME LANNISTER: I'm not sure I've ever smelled a dead cat.
CERSEI LANNISTER: Well, they smell like Pycelle."
JAIME LANNISTER: You drink more than you used to.
CERSEI LANNISTER: Yes.
JAIME LANNISTER: Why?
CERSEI LANNISTER: Let's see, you started a brawl in the streets with Ned Stark and disappeared from the capital. My husband died in a tragic hunting accident."
JAIME LANNISTER: It must have been traumatic for you.
CERSEI LANNISTER: My only daughter was shipped off to Dorne. We suffered through a siege.
JAIME LANNISTER: A rather short siege.
CERSEI LANNISTER: A rather short siege that I didn't expect to survive. And now I'm marrying my eldest son to a wicked little bitch from Highgarden while I'm supposed to marry her brother, a renowned pillow biter. So..."
JAIME LANNISTER: Father disowned me today.
CERSEI LANNISTER: He can't disown you. You're all he's got.
JAIME LANNISTER: You're forgetting Tyrion.
CERSEI LANNISTER: You don't really plan on staying in the Kingsguard, do you?"
JAIME LANNISTER: Staying in the Kingsguard means I live right here in the Red Keep with you.
CERSEI LANNISTER: Not now.
JAIME LANNISTER: I want... Not now? When? I've been back for weeks.
JAIME LANNISTER: Something's changed.
CERSEI LANNISTER: Everything's changed. You come back after all this time with no apologies and one hand and expect everything to be the same?
JAIME LANNISTER: What do you want me to apologize for?
CERSEI LANNISTER: For leaving me.
JAIME LANNISTER: You think I wanted to be taken prisoner?
CERSEI LANNISTER: Don't know what you wanted. You weren't here. You left me alone.
JAIME LANNISTER: Every day I was a prisoner, I plotted my escape. Every day. I murdered people so I could be here with you."
CERSEI LANNISTER: You took too long.
JAIME LANNISTER: I... What are you saying?
CERSEI LANNISTER: I'm saying you took too long.
CERSEI LANNISTER: Come in.
JAIME LANNISTER: Go away.
MAREI: Forgive me, Your Grace. You told me to come at once if there was anything important."
TORMUND: You plan on killing all the crows yourself?
YGRITTE: Do you plan on sitting here scratching your balls till winter?
TORMUND: We wait for Mance's orders.
YGRITTE: You sent a man over the Wall at the full moon. If he's not back yet, he's not coming back."
TORMUND: And what is it you want? March on Castle Black with just this lot? Your pretty crow said 1,000 men are nesting there."
YGRITTE: Yeah, well, he's a liar."
TORMUND: He is? Shouldn't it be ""he was""? You said you put three arrows in him."
YGRITTE: I did.
TORMUND: I've seen you slip a shaft through a rabbit's eye at 200 yards. If that boy's still walking, it's 'cause you let him go."
TORMUND: Thenns. I fucking hate Thenns.
TORMUND: Mance sent you?
TORMUND: How did you find us?
TORMUND: You came from the south, not the north."
WARG: Took a detour. Got some supper from a village down that way.
STYR: Why does the meat down here taste so much better than it does on our side of the Wall?
TORMUND: Help yourself.
STYR: Maybe everything's just better fed down here.
STYR: Fat and lazy. Easier for us, hmm?"
STYR: You didn't see us coming? Lost your warg? And that baby crow you had with you, lost him too?"
TORMUND: I'll answer to Mance. I won't answer to you.
STYR: She yours?
YGRITTE: I'm not anybody's.
STYR: Too scrawny. Not like those crows at Castle Black.
STYR: Think of them stuck in their larders stuffing their faces with ham and blood sausage and stew, getting nice and fat and marbled."
STYR: I know we've had our differences, Tormund, but just one time before you die, you really ought to try crow."
OFFICER: Draw. Loose.
JON SNOW: Last time I saw him, he was in the courtyard at Winterfell. ""He said, "" Next time I see you, you'll be all in black."" I was jealous of Robb my whole life. The way my father looked at him, I wanted that. He was better than me at everything... fighting and hunting and riding and girls. Gods, the girls loved him. I wanted to hate him, but I never could."
SAM: Sometimes I want to hate you.
SAM: Well, you're better than me at everything. Except reading."
SAM: They're... they're ready for you.
JON SNOW: He's wanted to hang me for a while. Now's his chance.
SAM: No one's going to hang you. You've done nothing wrong.
JON SNOW: I've done plenty wrong.
ALLISER THORNE: So you admit you murdered Qhorin Halfhand?
JON SNOW: I didn't murder him.
ALLISER THORNE: No? You put your sword through a brother of the Night's Watch. What do you call that?
JON SNOW: He wanted me to kill him.
JANOS SLYNT: A bastard son of a traitor. What would you expect?
JON SNOW: The Halfhand believed our only chance to stop Mance was to get a man inside his army.
ALLISER THORNE: Don't talk about the Halfhand as if you knew him. He was my brother.
JON SNOW: Then you'd know he'd do anything to defend the Wall. The free folk would have boiled him alive, but letting me kill him..."
JANOS SLYNT: The free folk? Listen to him. He even talks like a wildling now.
JON SNOW: Aye, I talk like a wildling. I ate with the wildlings. I climbed the Wall with the wildlings. I... I laid with a wildling girl."
JANOS SLYNT: You admit to breaking your vows, then?"
JON SNOW: I do.
JANOS SLYNT: The law is the law. The boy must die.
MAESTER AEMON: If we beheaded every ranger who lay with a girl, the Wall would be manned by headless men."
ALLISER THORNE: There's a difference between sneaking off to the Mole's Town brothel and sleeping with the enemy.
JON SNOW: While we sit here debating which rules I broke, Mance Rayder marches on the Wall with an army of 100,000."
ALLISER THORNE: Impossible. You can't get 50 wildlings together before they start killing each other.
JON SNOW: 100,000. He's united the Thenns, the Hornfoots, the ice-river clans. He has giants fighting for him."
JANOS SLYNT: Giants?
JON SNOW: Have you ever been beyond the Wall, ser?"
JANOS SLUNT: I commanded the City Watch of King's Landing, boy."
JON SNOW: And now you're here. You must not have been very good at your job.
JANOS SLYNT: How dare you?!
JON SNOW: There's a band of wildlings south of the Wall already led by Tormund Giantsbane. I killed their warg and three others. They shot me full of arrows. Their orders are to attack Castle Black from the south when Mance hits it from the north. The signal for the attack will be a bonfire. Mance said it would be the greatest fire the North has ever seen. That's the truth. All the truth.
JON SNOW: Do you intend to execute me or am I free to go?
MAESTER AEMON: None of us are free. We are men of the Night's Watch. But we won't be taking your head today, Jon Snow. Go on."
ALLISER THORNE: I am acting commander here, Maester Aemon."
MAESTER AEMON: Yes, you are."
ALLISER THORNE: And I don't trust the bastard.
MAESTER AEMON: He told the truth.
ALLISER THORNE: And you always know when a man's telling a lie? How did you acquire this magical power?
MAESTER AEMON: I grew up in King's Landing.
OLENNA TYRELL: No. No. You're a queen, not an ox."
OLENNA TYRELL: Your grandfather gave me a necklace just like this one for my 51st nameday.
MARGAERY TYRELL: The wedding is in a fortnight, Grandmother. You can't say no to everything."
OLENNA TYRELL: Nonsense.
OLENNA TYRELL: My little dears. Go and speak to the jewelers of King's Landing. Tell them who you are, tell them who sent you. The one who brings me the best necklace will get to keep the next best."
OLENNA TYRELL: The Margaery Tyrell who walks into the sept a fortnight from now will inspire 1,000 songs. Now, how sad it will be if she's wearing rubbish like that."
MARGAERY TYRELL: Perhaps I should just let Joffrey choose it for me. End up with a string of dead sparrow heads around my neck.
OLENNA TYRELL: You watch that. Even here, even with me."
OLENNA TYRELL: My word.
BRIENNE: My lady. My lady. Please pardon me for interrupting. My name is Brienne of Tarth.
OLENNA TYRELL: We know who you are. We've heard all about you. But hearing is one thing. Aren't you just marvelous? Absolutely singular.
OLENNA TYRELL: I hear you knocked my grandson into the dirt like the silly little boy he is.
BRIENNE: My lady, I know this is a very busy time for you, but if I could just have a moment."
OLENNA TYRELL: You dare not refuse.
MARGAERY TYRELL: A shadow?
BRIENNE: A shadow with the face of Stannis Baratheon. I swear to you by all the gods it was Stannis. He plunged his sword through Renly's heart and disappeared. One day, my lady, I will avenge our king."
MARGAERY TYRELL: Joffrey is our king now.
BRIENNE: I meant no offense.
MARGAERY TYRELL: And you've given none.
JAIME LANNISTER: All the Kingsguard will be on duty, of course. Ser Boros will be stationed here. Ser Preston will be stationed here beside the primary entertainment. Your Grace?"
JOFFREY LANNISTER: Yes, yes, one guard at the... the thing. Go on."
JAIME LANNISTER: Ser Meryn will guard Lady Margaery and Tommen.
MERYN: I've always guarded the king himself, my lord. Ever since your absence."
JAIME LANNISTER: And I thank you for it, Ser Meryn. All very good. I don't expect any trouble."
MERYN: The people love their king. They know who keeps them fed.
JAIME LANNISTER: Margaery Tyrell, I've heard."
JOFFREY LANNISTER: By my leave. They know I saved the city. They know I won the war.
JAIME LANNISTER: The war's not won. Not while Stannis lives.
JOFFREY LANNISTER: I broke Stannis on the Blackwater. Pity you weren't there to help, Uncle."
JAIME LANNISTER: My apologies, Your Grace. I was rather busy."
JOFFREY LANNISTER: Busy getting captured.
JAIME LANNISTER: So this is the famous ""Book of Brothers""? All the great deeds of all the great Kingsguard. Ser Arthur Dayne. The Sword of the Morning. Led the attack on the Kingswood Brotherhood. Defeated the Smiling Knight in single combat. Ser Duncan the Tall. Four pages for Ser Duncan. He must have been quite a man."
JAIME LANNISTER: So they say.
JOFFREY LANNISTER: Ser Jaime Lannister.
JOFFREY LANNISTER: Someone forgot to write down all your great deeds.
JAIME LANNISTER: There's still time.
JOFFREY LANNISTER: Is there? For a 40-year-old knight with one hand? How can you protect me with that?
JAIME LANNISTER: I use my left hand now, Your Grace. Makes for more of a contest."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Have you ever been to Meereen?
MISSANDEI: Several times, Your Grace, with Master Kraznys."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: And?
MISSANDEI: They say 1,000 slaves died building the Great Pyramid of Meereen."
